Ki Hadjar Dewantara

Father of Indonesian National Education

In recognition for his dedication and accomplishments in pioneering public education in Indonesia, he was declared as the Father of Indonesian National Education, a national hero, and his birthday is appointed as the National Education Day, through Presidential Decree no. 305 of 1959, dated 28 November 1959.

Here's a time line of Ki Hadjar Dewantara's life:

  • 1889 - Born on May 2, in Pakualaman, Hindia Belanda
  • 1908 - Socialize and promote public awareness of Indonesia as a national unity and organized Boedi Oetomo's first congress in Yogyakarta.
  • 1913 - Write critical column "If I were a Dutchman" ("Als ik eens Nederlander was"). As a consequence, he was arrested under the order of Governor General Idenburg. During his exile in the Netherlands, he was active in Indische Vereeniging and founded the Indonesisch Pers-bureau.
  • 1919 - Returned home to Java and joined his brother in establishing a school in his native hometown.
  • 1922 - Founded the Nationaal Onderwijs Instituut Ampel or the national college (Taman Siswa)
  • 1929 - Choose "Ki Hadjar Dewantara" as his new name and scrapped the Javanese gentility title Raden Mas in front of his name. It was a gesture to demonstrate his support for social equality and his disregard for rigid social stature of Javanese society.
  • 1946 - Choose "Ki Hadjar Dewantara" as his new name and scrapped the Javanese gentility title Raden Mas in front of his name. It was a gesture to demonstrate his support for social equality and his disregard for rigid social stature of Javanese society.
  • 1959 - Died on April 26, in Yogyakarta, Indonesia

"Ing ngarso sung tulodo, ing madyo mangun karso, tut wuri handayani" -Ki Hadjar Dewantara

If you have time, you should read more about this incredible human being on his Wikipedia entry.
